thread.title: Pilot dies as flight from Phoenix diverted to Syracuse
thread.title_full: Pilot dies as flight from Phoenix diverted to Syracuse

author: Joseph Spector, @GannettAlbany
title: Pilot dies as flight from Phoenix diverted to Syracuse
text:
An American Airlines flight from Phoenix to Boston was diverted to Syracuse after the plane's captain became ill and later died, the Associated Press reported. Airline Spokeswoman Andrea Huguely told the AP that Flight 550 was diverted shortly after 7 a.m. Monday and the first officer safely landed the plane. She also confirmed that the flight’s captain had died, but it was unclear when and no details about the pilot were released.
“We are incredibly saddened by this event, and we are focused on caring for our pilot’s family and colleagues,” the airline's statement said.
The plane had 147 passengers and five crew members, American Airlines said told the Post-Standard in Syracuse.
A replacement crew was headed to Syracuse to take passengers to Boston, and the passengers have since been taken there.
Before the flight landed, the first officer was heard telling the airport tower, “American 550. Medical emergency. Captain is incapacitated.”
( Photo via Syracuse International Airport )
Joseph Spector Albany bureau chief: Joseph Spector is Gannett's Albany Bureau chief and has covered New York politics and government since 2002. He was the political reporter for the Democrat and Chronicle in Rochester and in 2007 joined Gannett’s Albany Bureau, covering state government for seven news organizations ;and USA Today.
